title: 103_hr2034
content: The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is authorized to carry out major medical facility projects, including construction at Elmendorf Air Force Base in Alaska and a psychiatric building at the Medical Center in Lyons, New Jersey, with specified funding amounts. Construction projects at various Veterans Affairs Medical Centers include modernization and seismic corrections in Memphis, Tennessee, a replacement bed building in Muskogee, Oklahoma, an outpatient care addition and parking garage in San Juan, Puerto Rico, and a 120-bed nursing home facility in the Chesapeake network area. Total funding amounts to $131,600,000. The Secretary will select a site for a project in Columbia, conducting a study to determine the best location for the facility. This includes defining the mission of each medical center in the Chesapeake network to improve planning, reduce duplication, realign services, distribute resources effectively, and deliver services efficiently. Expansion and modernization needs will also be assessed. The Secretary will conduct a study to determine the need for expansion and modernization of the nursing home care unit at Fort Howard, Maryland, and the impact of constructing nursing home beds in Baltimore on other medical centers in the Chesapeake network. Within 90 days of enactment, a report with the Secretary's determinations will be submitted to the Committees on Veterans Affairs of the Senate and House. Authorization of appropriations for the study on expansion and modernization of the nursing home care unit at Fort Howard, Maryland, and the impact on other medical centers in the Chesapeake network. In fiscal year 1994, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs is authorized to appropriate funds for major medical facility projects and leases. The total amount authorized is $143,100,000 for projects and $50,123,105 for leases. These projects can only be carried out using funds allocated for fiscal year 1994. SEC. 3 increases the facility project threshold from $2,000,000 to $3,000,000 in title 38, United States Code. SEC. 4 extends the lease authority term for Pershing Hall, France from 35 years to 99 years.
